#summary documentation for the MSX core

= Introduction =

This page has operating instructions for the MSX core.
This core is based on OneChipMSX

= Links =
  * [http://retroramblings.net/?page_id=917 Core home page]
  * [http://retroramblings.net/?page_id=921 Quick start guide]

= Installation =

The core requires an SD card formatted in FAT16 to work properly. You will also need to provide a few system files and utilities. You can find instructions on formatting SD cards on the [http://retroramblings.net/?page_id=917 core's homepage].

You can also use the following MSX Starter Pack to extract on a blank SD card formatted in FAT16.
It includes a few programs and a file manager to easily browse files:

  * [http://newsdee.com/mist/msx_sd_card_0.5.zip MSX Starter Pack v0.5]

== Notes ==

  * PAL video mode is 720x576p 50hz 
  * NTSC video mode is 720x481p 60hz
  * TV video mode is 720x240p 60hz (works best with UMSA+XRGB-Mini)
